message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the problem of human re-identification in visual surveillance, which is a subfield of computer vision. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper proposes a novel siamese Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) architecture that can process image regions sequentially and enhance the discriminative capability of local feature representation by leveraging contextual information. This involves the use of deep learning techniques, which falls under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also mentions the use of datasets such as Market-1501, CUHK03 and VIPeR, which are commonly used in computer vision research, and hence, cs.MM (Multimedia) is also a likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves the use of feedback connections and internal gating mechanism, which are related to artificial intelligence and neural networks, and hence, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with visual surveillance, which involves security and privacy concerns, and hence, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is also a possible sub-category.
